Class BufferedIOStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      BufferedIOStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class BufferedIOStream
extends InputStream

Class that turns an output stream into an input stream. The internal buffer grows if writting rate is higher than reading rate. TODO

  • Implement long skip(long) to improve performance

          A stream with a default 4k buffer.

BufferedIOStream

public BufferedIOStream(int initialBuffer)
A stream with the suggested buffer.

Parameters:
initialBuffer - The initial buffer size. If buffer is less than 2, buffer will be 512 bytes.

read

public int read()
         throws IOException
Reads one byte that was written to the output stream. Will block if there is nothing to read.

Specified by:
read in class InputStream
Returns:
the next byte, or -1 if the output stream was closed and all data has been read.
Throws:
IOException - If the stream has already been closed or the thread is interrupted.

read

public int read(byte[] b)
         throws IOException
Read bytes directly into a buffer. The number of bytes actually read will be the lesser of b.length and available().

Overrides:
read in class InputStream
Parameters:
b - Buffer to read bytes into
Returns:
-1 for end of stream, or number of bytes actually read.
Throws:
IOException

read

public int read(byte[] b,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws IOException
Reads up to a number of bytes directly into a given buffer. The number of bytes actually read will be the lesser of len, b.length, available().

Overrides:
read in class InputStream
Parameters:
b - Buffer to read bytes into
off - The offset to start storing the bytes
len - The maximum number of bytes to store
Returns:
-1 for end of stream, or number of bytes actually read.
Throws:
IOException - If stream is closed or someone notified us but there is not data in the buffer and the OutputStream has not been closed.

main

public static void main(String... args)
Test. Test expanding the buffer with data split at the beginning and end of the buffer. Also tests expanding when all data is at the beginning of the buffer. Tests all three reads. Tests write byte and write buffer (does not test write partial buffer).
